content.raw:
Hi,

Thank you for a great and useful lib.

I'm trying to calculate the mass of the peptide with an n-terminal label (Acetylation)
I set the composition of the modification as follows:


```
#!python

db = mass.Unimod()
aa_comp = dict(mass.std_aa_comp)
aa_comp['ace'] = db.by_title('Acetyl')['composition']
```


Then I try to calculate the mass:

```
#!python

mass.calculate_mass(sequence="ace-SAMPLE-OH",aa_comp=aa_comp)
```


But this gives an error:
pyteomics.auxiliary.PyteomicsError: Pyteomics error, message: 'Unknown amino acid in sequence ace-SAMPLE-OH at position 1: ace-SAMPLE-OH'

How can I specify the composition of an n-terminal label?

many thanks,
Sven Degroeve


VIB Department of Medical Protein Research, UGent
Albert Baertsoenkaai 3
B-9000 GENT
BELGIUM
content.html:
Hi,

Thank you for a great and useful lib.

I'm trying to calculate the mass of the peptide with an n-terminal label (Acetylation) I set the composition of the modification as follows:

db = mass.Unimod()
aa_comp = dict(mass.std_aa_comp)
aa_comp['ace'] = db.by_title('Acetyl')['composition']

Then I try to calculate the mass:

mass.calculate_mass(sequence="ace-SAMPLE-OH",aa_comp=aa_comp)

But this gives an error: pyteomics.auxiliary.PyteomicsError: Pyteomics error, message: 'Unknown amino acid in sequence ace-SAMPLE-OH at position 1: ace-SAMPLE-OH'

How can I specify the composition of an n-terminal label?

many thanks, Sven Degroeve

VIB Department of Medical Protein Research, UGent Albert Baertsoenkaai 3 B-9000 GENT BELGIUM
